body: Sorry about that... I kicked a build after my changes and everything was fine... I don't really understand, maybe I was on the wrong branch....

make by itself doesn't build & run tests... you probably want to get in the
habit of:

tools/run_tests/run_tests.py -c dbg

to do so

On Fri Jan 16 2015 at 8:53:59 AM jboeuf notifications@github.com wrote:

> Merged #83 https://github.com/google/grpc/pull/83.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/google/grpc/pull/83#event-220187782.

OK, will do. Is there a central place for documentation on these things? I
looks like I'm gathering bits and pieces from different sources (like the
fact that I have to install protobuf manually for example).

On Fri, Jan 16, 2015 at 8:57 AM, Craig Tiller notifications@github.com
wrote:

> make by itself doesn't build & run tests... you probably want to get in
> the

I started a page on the wiki:
https://github.com/google/grpc/wiki/C-C---development-knowhow
